titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Norah Chase Papers on the City University of New York Professional Staff Congress WAG.122

did.unittitle: Norah Chase Papers on the City University of New York Professional Staff Congress

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Nora Chase Papers; WAG 122; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Nora Chase sent a gift of her papers to Tamiment Library, the date of this donation is unknown. The accession number associated with this gift is 1950.078.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Norah Chase, an associate professor of English at Kingsborough Community College in Brooklyn, N.Y., and a long-time activist in the Professional Staff Congress (PSC), the labor union representing college teachers in the City University of New York system, donated these materials. This collection contains copies of Unity News, pamphlets, flyers, correspondence, and meeting minutes related to the 2000 election of PSC officers and representatives by Chase and other members of the union's Unity Caucus.
